quiz.question: Which item contains zero calories and no nutrients?
Which number does the FDA use as the reference daily calorie intake on labels?
Which food component can reduce measured metabolizable energy through fermentation in the colon?
Which snack change lowers calories without removing nutrients?
Which term describes calories available to the body after digestion and losses?
Which nutritional label practice can mislead consumers about calorie contribution from mixed dishes?
Which food component increases energy density most per gram?
Which labeling term helps consumers see how a serving fits into a 2,000 calorie diet?
Which nuanced factor makes calorie estimates less accurate for highly processed versus whole foods?
options: Altered digestibility and faster absorption rates
Higher vitamin content in processed foods
quiz.answer: Altered digestibility and faster absorption rates

quiz.question: Which nutrient primarily helps build and repair body tissues?
What is the main difference between glycemic index and glycemic load?
options: Glycemic load combines index with typical carbohydrate portion size
quiz.answer: Glycemic load combines index with typical carbohydrate portion size

quiz.question: Which laboratory approach estimates human metabolizable energy more accurately than simple combustion?
options: Balance studies measuring intake and excreta
quiz.answer: Balance studies measuring intake and excreta

quiz.question: Which macronutrient provides about 9 kilocalories per gram?
Which phrase best describes percent of calories from fat on nutrition labels?
options: Proportion of total calories derived from fat
Grams of fat per hundred calories
quiz.answer: Proportion of total calories derived from fat

quiz.question: Which term describes energy remaining after fecal and urinary losses are subtracted?
